contents.content: I feel like the Array.flat method is often forgotten in the web dev world, it does the simple thing of flattening an array and transforms this:
essentially finding all the arrays in the instantiated array and inserting their contents starting at the indexes of the found arrays (plus the length of already inserted contents).
It's basically an hydraulic press for arrays.
It can take a number as an argument which defines how deep the array should go to flatten its contents, by default it's 1, but you can set it to Infinity to flatten arrays as deep as possible.
In some cases this method can be quite useful, I find myself using it a lot when a value could also be treated as an array of values.

For example, there is this function in the codebase of a client that fetches articles based on their ids. This function can either fetch one or multiple articles if a single id or an array of ids is passed by argument.

Now both cases are handled, listIds will always be an array of depth 1, whether we have a single id or a list of ids, no need for conditions to check the types of argument or separate fetch calls.
